text: ਸੋ ਮੁਲਾਂ ਜੋ ਮਨ ਸਿਉ ਲਰੈ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He alone is a Mullah, who struggles with his mind,

transliteration.text: sō mulānh jō man siu larai .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: and through the Guru's Teachings, fights with death.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He crushes the pride of the Messenger of Death.

translation.text: Unto that Mullah, I ever offer greetings of respect. ||1||

translation.text: God is present, right here at hand; why do you say that He is far away?

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Tie up your disturbing passions, and find the Beauteous Lord. ||1||Pause||

text: ਤਿਸੁ ਕਾਜੀ ਕਉ ਜਰਾ ਨ ਮਰਨਾ ॥੨॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: for such a Qazi, there is no old age or death. ||2||

transliteration.text: tis kājī kau jarā n maranā .2.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He alone is a sultan and a king, who shoots the two arrows,

transliteration.text: sō suratān j dui sar tānai .

translation.text: The Lord and Master of Kabeer is all-pervading. ||4||3||11||
